questions.question: The First Triumvirate Quiz
How much had Pompey's reorganisation of the east increased Roman tax revenue?
How much money did Pompey add to the Treasury?
In what year did Pompey send Piso to Rome to stand for election to represent his interests?
Who was the consul for 60 that was not friendly to Pompey's interests?
Who did Pompey send to become elected consul for 60?
How did Pompey ensure Afranius was elected?
Who opposed Pompey's interests when Afranius started to propose them?
Who was the Tribune that presented a land bill to the people on behalf of Pompey?
What did Flavius do when Metellus spoke against this bill?
Who were the publicani?
Why did the publicani want to be released from 1/3 of the cost of their contracts?
options: They wanted more control over their collections
They were underpaid for their work
They had overbid, and were collecting less than expected, so would make less profit

questions.question: Who surprisingly, alongside Crassus, spoke in favor of the publicani?
Why did Cicero favor making the publicani happy?
options: To gain popularity among the people
Concordia ordinum - harmony of the orders
To avoid conflict with the Senate

questions.question: Who spoke against the interests of the publicani?
Where had Caesar been pro-praetorian governor in 61?
What did Caesar want on his return to Rome?
options: To fight in the civil wars
To stand for consul in absentia and have a triumph

questions.question: What did Caesar request so he could have both?
options: The restoration of the corn dole

questions.question: How did Cato ensure this proposal was left undecided?
Why might Cato have opposed Caesar in his candidature for personal reasons?
options: He insulted him in public speeches
His son-in-law was up for election, and had always previously been outshone by Caesar
Caesar was married to his daughter

questions.question: What was the First Triumvirate?
options: A religious ceremony involving three Roman leaders
A military alliance between Pompey, Crassus, and Cicero
A formal agreement between the Senate, Pompey, and Crassus
An informal alliance to help all three get what they wanted

questions.question: How did the Optimates ensure that Bibulus was elected alongside Caesar?
What proconsular command did the Senate allot to Caesar in the first instance?
options: The woods and pastures of Italy
